item.description:
Hi Incubators! 

We have been invited to partake in all or part of the following below.  This is an entirely free theater conference, especially useful if you are interested in teaching theater or education in general in the future but also eye opening in terms of your performance ability and the free performances from some outstanding international groups!

Check it out and let me know if you have questions or want further details. 

Click the link and hope to see some of you there!

Cheers!

 

Jason

 

Dear Theater Artists, Educators and Practitioners, 

 

On behalf of The Cambridge School of Weston (CSW), we would like to invite you to:

 

T5 International Performance Festival and Conference

Thursday, August 18 through Sunday, August 21, 2011

www.csw.org/T5 

*PERFORMANCES, 8/18-8/21-- International troupes perform three plays by Eugene Ionesco

*CONFERENCE DAY, Sat.8/20  -- Conversations, Perspectives & Demonstations of Progressive Education

*MASTERCLASSES, Fri. 8/19 -- Acting, Dancing & Experiential Work with outstanding teachers

 

 

CSW together with the UNESCO Chair in Theatre and Culture of Civilizations of the International Theatre Institute are proud to showcase this festival and inaugurate the international T5 Institute - Teaching Teachers To Teach Theater-with free performances, master classes and a conference with leading theatre schools from across the world.

 

 All events are FREE & open to the public

 REGISTER NOW to attend

 

The four-day festival will focus on the pedagogy of teaching theatre through adaptations of three plays of Eugene Ionesco (The Lesson; Pim Pam Pum; The Bald Soprano). These plays challenge our traditional notions of teaching and learning and serve as a focus to the entire weekend. Three international performance troupes will perform the plays in their respective languages, including Spanish, Slovene and English. An open discussion with the artists, teachers and students involved in their creation will follow the daily performances:

 

Thursday 8/18 -- Performances at 6:30 p.m.

Friday 8/19 at -- Workshops/Masterclasses 1-5 p.m.; Performances at 7 p.m.

Saturday 8/20 -- Conference Day, 8 a.m. - 8 p.m.; Performances throughout the day & evening

Sunday 8/20 -- Performances at 11am

 

 

The T5 festival features a conference, on Saturday, August 20, including keynote addresses delivered by leaders of the international delegations to discuss progressive practice and pedagogy in theatre education as well as hold workshops, master classes and demonstrations.

 

The T5 International Performance Festival and Conference will be held and hosted by:

 

The Cambridge School of Weston

45 Georgian Road      

Weston, MA 02493 ( www.csw.org/directions)

 

To reserve your free space at a performance or the conference, or to find a detailed

performance schedule and additional information, please visit: www.csw.org/T5

 

Questions? call Caitlin our T5 Festival Coordinator at (570) 574-1207

 

Thank you,

 

Jeffrey & T5 Festival Team

  

Jeffrey Sichel

Chair, Theater Department, The Cambridge School of Weston

Permanent Delegate of The UNESCO Chair - ITI for The United States

 

 

Founding Members of the T5 Institute:
The Cambridge School of Weston
The UNESCO Chair in Theatre and Culture of Civilizations of the International Theatre Institute
The Shanghai Theatre Academy, China
European Union of the Theatre Academies and Schools, European Union
Ludwig Maximilians University of Munich, Germany
The National School of Drama, New Delhi, India
Universidad Nacional Autonoma de Mexico (UNAM), Mexico
The University of Ljubljana, Slovenia
The University of Cape Town, South Africa
Georgetown University, United States
item.how_to_find_us: Hop in a car, use a GPS or dare i say use road signs!
item.name: T5 International Performance Festival and Conference: FREE!!!
